pages.text: Without instructions, the T-800 will fall back to its default programming of standing still and assessing nearby entities. For tasks of more value to the user, a command tool is required.
Right clicking any block or entity selects the object to be used to supply information to $(l:commands)commands$() easily.

When right clicking a robot specifically, it can then be ordered to do a variety of tasks by subsequently right clicking:
$(li)a block to move to and temporarily stay
$(li)a hostile entity to attack it
$(li)a passive entity to protect it
$(li)when holding a pickaxe: a block to mine it
$(li)when holding a block: a position to place it

When shift-right-clicking a robot, the robot is added to this command-tool's group. By right clicking in the air to open the command interface, all robots of this group can be accessed from anywhere (as long as they are loaded). Item transactions are only possible over short distances. The group of a command tool can be copied to another command tool by crafting them together. They will also share robots to be added and removed in the future.
